memory_verse.label: Today's Bread
memory_verse.text: “Behold, I give you the authority to trample on serpents and scorpions, and over all the power of the enemy, and nothing shall by any means hurt you.” (Luke 10:19)

devotion.label: Devotion
devotion.text:
The Lord gives us, on one hand, authority to trample serpents and scorpions, and on the other hand, promises that nothing shall harm us. In this verse, the word serpent symbolizes Satan, and scorpions represent demonic forces.

Many are tormented by the spirits of serpents, even in their dreams. Whether it's the spirit of a demon or a serpent, take a stand against it using the authority the Lord has given you.

God has granted you a threefold blessing — authority, dominion, and power — which are available through three divine sources: the Name of Jesus, the Blood of Christ, and the anointing of the Holy Spirit. If you lay hold of these, you will become stronger than the devil and be equipped to destroy his works.

Hold forth the Blood of Jesus in your hands. Declare, “In the name of Jesus, enemy, I sprinkle fire upon you!” Confront every force—witchcraft, mountains of resistance, demonic powers—saying, “Who are you, O great mountain, before my God? Whoever falls on this Stone will be broken, and on whomever it falls, it will grind him to powder.” Stand firm and resist the devil!

The Bible says, “And these signs will follow those who believe: In My name they will cast out demons” (Mark 16:17). “And when Lord Jesus had called His twelve disciples to Him, He gave them power over unclean spirits, to cast them out, and to heal all kinds of sickness and all kinds of disease.” (Matthew 10:1)

Jesus Christ came into this world to destroy the works of the devil (1 John 3:8). “He who is in you is greater than he who is in the world.” (1 John 4:4). God has placed authority in your hands to break the works of Satan. No wicked person can stand against you. No plan of the enemy can rob you of your peace. The victorious Christ stands beside you always!

As the Psalmist says, “The Lord of hosts is with us; the God of Jacob is our refuge.” (Psalm 46:11)

Children of God, those who come against you one way will flee from you in seven ways. The Lord will fill you with power and His promise so no one can stand against you. Use the authority He has given and drive out the enemy!

conclusion.label: Verse for further meditation
text: Verse for further meditation: “And they overcame him by the blood of the Lamb and by the word of their testimony.” (Revelation 12:11)
